TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RoutedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

summary.span: 包含与路由事件相关联的状态信息和事件数据。

span.span: Contains state information and event data associated with a routed event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不同可以在单个。Different can be used with a single . 此类负责打包的事件数据、 提供额外的事件的状态信息，以及由事件系统用于调用处理程序与路由事件相关联。This class is responsible for packaging the event data for a , providing extra event state information, and is used by the event system for invoking the handler associated with the routed event.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此无参数构造函数、 新的所有公共属性时实例假定有以下默认值：When using this parameterless constructor, all public properties of the new instance assume the following default values: - 默认为`null`。 defaults to `null`. - 默认值为 `false` defaults to `false` - 默认为`null`。 defaults to `null`. - 默认为`null`。 defaults to `null`. 为空值并只意味着数据不会尝试指定的源。Null values for and only mean that the data makes no attempt to specify the source. 对的调用中使用此实例时，则和基于元素引发该事件并将传递到侦听器通过路由填充值。When this instance is used in a call to , the and values are populated based on the element that raised the event and are passed on to listeners through the routing.

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the supplied routed event identifier, and providing the opportunity to declare a different source for the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在使用此重载的构造函数时，未指定属性的新实例假定有以下默认值：When using this overloaded constructor, unspecified properties of the new instance assume the following default values: - 默认值为 `false` defaults to `false` - 默认为`null`。 defaults to `null`. 为空值的元素引发该事件并将其通过路由，将基于填充，但将读取`null`之前调用。Null values for are populated based on the element that raised the event and passed on through the routing, but will read `null` prior to invocation. 传递时使用此签名到虚方法，如，使用参数来调用在内部。Use this signature when passing to virtuals such as , where the arguments are used to call internally.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Handled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Handled : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示针对路由事件（在其经过路由时）的事件处理的当前状态。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates the present state of the event handling for a routed event as it travels the route.

value.span: 如果设置，将设置为事件将标记为已处理; 否则为如果。

span.span: If setting, set to if the event is to be marked handled; otherwise .

value.span: 如果读取此值，指示的类处理程序或沿路由的某个实例处理程序具有已标记为处理此事件。

span.span: If reading this value, indicates that either a class handler, or some instance handler along the route, has already marked this event handled.

value.span: .指示没有这类处理程序将该事件标记为已处理。

span.span: .indicates that no such handler has marked the event handled.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将标记为处理的事件将限制到侦听器为由事件路由的路由事件的可见性。Marking the event handled will limit the visibility of the routed event to listeners along the event route. 该事件仍经过路由的其余部分，但仅处理程序明确添加的其`HandledEventsToo``true`中方法调用将调用以响应。The event does still travel the remainder of the route, but only handlers specifically added with `HandledEventsToo` `true` in the method call will be invoked in response. 默认实例侦听器上的处理程序 (如那些表示[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)]) 将不会调用。Default handlers on instance listeners (such as those expressed in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)]) will not be invoked. 处理标记为已处理的事件不是一种常见方案。Handling events that are marked handled is not a common scenario. 如果您是控件作者定义你自己的事件，所做的决策有关事件在类级别的处理会影响控件的用户以及派生控件的所有用户和可能是其他元素所包含的控件或包含您的控件。If you are a control author defining your own events, the decisions you make regarding event handling at the class level will impact users of your control as well as any users of derived controls, and potentially other elements that are either contained by your control or that contain your control. 有关详细信息，请参阅[将路由事件标记为“已处理”和类处理](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/marking-routed-events-as-handled-and-class-handling.md)。For more information, see [Marking Routed Events as Handled, and Class Handling](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/marking-routed-events-as-handled-and-class-handling.md). 在极少数情况下非常适合处理其中标记`true`，并通过更改来修改事件参数到`false`。In very rare circumstances it is appropriate to handle events where is marked `true`, and modify the event arguments by changing to `false`. 这可能是必需的输入事件的控件，如密钥处理的某些区域中与，低级别和高级别输入的事件会争用处理，以及每个正在尝试使用不同的路由策略。This can be necessary in certain areas of input events of controls, such as key handling of versus where low level and high level input events compete for the handling, and each is attempting to work with a different routing strategy. ## Examples 下面的示例实现事件处理程序中用于标记处理的事件。The following example implements an event handler that marks the event handled. [!code-csharp[ClassHandling#OnStarClassHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClassHandling/CSharp/SDKSampleLibrary/class1.cs#onstarclasshandler)] [!code-vb[ClassHandling#OnStarClassHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ClassHandling/visualbasic/sdksamplelibrary/class1.vb#onstarclasshandler)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void InvokeEventHandler (Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void InvokeEventHandler(class System.Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub InvokeEventHandler (genericHandler As Delegate, genericTarget As Object)
protected: virtual void InvokeEventHandler(Delegate ^ genericHandler, System::Object ^ genericTarget);
abstract member InvokeEventHandler : Delegate * obj -> unit override this.InvokeEventHandler : Delegate * obj -> unit

param.name: genericHandler
param.span: 要调用的泛型处理程序/委托实现。

span.span: The generic handler / delegate implementation to be invoked.

param.name: genericTarget
param.span: 应在其上调用所提供的处理程序的目标。

span.span: The target on which the provided handler should be invoked.

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，提供特定于类型的调用事件处理程序的方式，该方式与基实现相比可提高效率。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, provides a way to invoke event handlers in a type-specific way, which can increase efficiency over the base implementation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 基实现合并了反射来确定正确的处理程序的任何情况下，该处理程序不是按字面意思，并且此反射步骤具有一些性能产生负面影响。The base implementation incorporates reflection to determine the right handler for any case where the handler is not literally , and this reflection step does have some performance consequences. 调用可以进行更高效通过不依赖于反射。Invocations can be made more efficient by not relying on reflection. 这是使得此方法可用于选择要将其重写任何路由的事件参数类的方案。This is the scenario that motivates this method being available for any routed event arguments class that choose to override it. 实现不应调用基针对此方法，因为您的实现应负责调用类型安全处理程序。Implementations should not call the base for this method, because your implementation should already be responsible for invoking the type safe handlers. ## Examples 下面是伪代码说明了可用于实现的基本模式。The following is pseudocode that illustrates a basic pattern that can be used for implementation. 在这里，`MyRoutedEventHandler`是一个的子类。Here, `MyRoutedEventHandler` is a subclass of . [!code-csharp[CorePseudocode#RoutedEventArgs](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/CSharp/corepseudocode.cs#routedeventargs)] [!code-vb[CorePseudocode#RoutedEventArgs](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/visualbasic/corepseudocode.vb#routedeventargs)]

span.para: 此方法旨在由派生的事件数据类以提供更有效地调用其委托的重写。实现应强制转换提供到特定于类型的委托，，然后调用该处理程序。默认实现将尝试调用提供处理程序，尝试将其转换为。如果任一或作为提供，将引发异常。

This method is intended to be overridden by derived event data classes to provide more efficient invocation of their delegates. The implementation should cast the provided to the type-specific delegate, and then invoke that handler. The default implementation will attempt to invoke the provided handler, attempting to cast it as . If either or is provided as , exceptions will be raised.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSetSource(object source) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnSetSource (source As Object)
abstract member OnSetSource : obj -> unit override this.OnSetSource : obj -> unit

span.span: The new value that is being set to.

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，每当实例的 属性的值发生更改，则提供一个通知回调入口点。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, provides a notification callback entry point whenever the value of the property of an instance changes.

span.para: 以编程方式更改报告的事件源可能需要更新事件中的特定于类型的数据。出于此原因，方法受保护的虚拟，应由的子类中重写。此方法具有默认实现。

Changing the reported source of an event programmatically can potentially require updating the type-specific data within the event. For this reason, the method is protected virtual and is intended to be overridden by subclasses of . This method has no default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OriginalSource As Object
public: property System::Object ^ OriginalSource { System::Object ^ get(); };

summary.span: 在父类进行任何可能的 调整之前，获取由纯命中测试确定的原始报告源。

span.span: Gets the original reporting source as determined by pure hit testing, before any possible adjustment by a parent class.

value.span: 在类处理进行任何可能的 调整之前的原始报告源，可能已进行该调整以展平复合元素树。

span.span: The original reporting source, before any possible adjustment made by class handling, which may have been done to flatten composited element trees.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 之前类事件处理程序或任何实例处理程序调用，并永远不会调整忽略这一点后，将此属性获取其值。This property acquires its value once, before the class event handlers or any instance handlers are invoked, and is never adjusted past this point. 原始的源信息是只读的类处理程序或类实现中，就像它在事件数据中报告。The original source information is read-only to class handlers or class implementations, just as it is reported in the event data. 常见的情况下可能会进行调整源，其中包含控件的内容模型内的内容元素 (的列表项，例如，内容将报告作为列表项元素和列表项中的实际元素将是.Common cases where the source may be adjusted include content elements inside a content model for a control (the contents of a list item, for instance, will report the list item element as the and the actual element within the list item will be the . 各种元素和内容模型的源调整各不相同类的。Source adjustment by various elements and content models varies from class to class. 调整事件源的每个类尝试预测哪个源是最有用报告为大多数输入的方案和类所针对的方案，然后将该源作为。Each class that adjusts event sources attempts to anticipate which source is the most useful to report for most input scenarios and the scenarios for which the class is intended, and then sets that source as the . 如果此源不是已处理事件的相关，请尝试检查改为以确定它是否报告更适合的不同源。If this source is not the one that has relevance to your handling of the event, try checking instead to see if it reports a different source that is more suitable. 输入事件的更多详细信息，请参阅[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more details on input events, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::RoutedEvent ^ RoutedEvent { System::Windows::RoutedEvent ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::RoutedEvent ^ value); };
member this.RoutedEvent : System.Windows.RoutedEvent with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置与此 实例关联的 。

span.span: Gets or sets the associated with this instance.

value.span: 已调用的事件的标识符。

span.span: The identifier for the event that has been invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不能将此值设置上，已经传送 （例如，如果获得通过处理程序自变量）。You cannot set this value on a that has already been routed (for instance, if you obtained the arguments through a handler). 尝试执行此操作将生成一个异常。Attempting to do so will generate an exception. 你仅可以将其设置未尚未使用生成的事件调用的实例上。You can only set it on an instance that has not yet been used to generate an invocation of the event. 值不能为`null`在任何时间。The value of cannot be `null` at any time. ## Examples 下面的示例使用一个初始的构造函数创建新的路由的事件数据，然后设置属性用作后续操作。The following example creates new routed event data with an initial constructor and then sets the property as a subsequent operation. 您必须具有引发路由的事件之前设置。You must have set prior to raising the routed event. [!code-csharp[ColorPicker_v2#RoutedEventArgsRoutedEvent](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ColorPicker_v2/CSharp/ColorPicker.cs#routedeventargsroutedevent)] [!code-vb[ColorPicker_v2#RoutedEventArgsRoutedEvent](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ColorPicker_v2/visualbasic/colorpicker.vb#routedeventargsroutedevent)]

exception.span: 在路由事件时试图更改 值。

span.span: Attempted to change the value while the event is being routed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Source { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };
member this.Source : obj with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置对引发事件的对象的引用。

span.span: Gets or sets a reference to the object that raised the event.
The object that raised the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于任何浮升路由事件的实际经过引发，它的元素之外的路由，并为任何隧道路由事件不具有尚未挖掘引发它的值的元素到的值与不同`sender`参数的事件参数类。For any bubbling routed event that has actually traveled the route beyond the element that raised it, and for any tunneling routed event that has not yet tunneled down to the element that raised it, the value of will be different than the value of the `sender` parameter of the event arguments class. 这两个元素的事件中涉及到在任何给定的处理程序中最重要的是 (，引发它，该元素或`sender`，当前正在处理它的元素) 取决于您的处理程序的应用程序逻辑寻址。Which of the two elements involved in the event is of the most importance in any given handler (, the element that raised it, or `sender`, the element that is currently handling it) is dependent on the application logic that your handler is addressing. 设置此属性通常只是当重写或实现其他[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]调整事件源，例如类处理事件。Setting this property is typically only done when overriding or implementing other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] that adjust event sources, such as when class handling an event. 不建议重置从实例处理程序的明显的事件源，尤其是在处理程序不会不将事件标记为已处理时。Resetting apparent event sources from instance handlers is not recommended, particularly when the handler does not mark the event as handled. 如果执行重置报告不同的事件源将继续的报告作为第一个源引发的起源调用。If you do reset to report a different event source, will continue to report the source as first raised by the originating call.
